QuestionText: During times of stress, koalas are prone to outbreaks of the disease chlamydia.
AnswerText: In some parts of Australia, koala infection rates from the disease chlamydia is as high as 90%.

QuestionText: Koala joeys are born with no hair, no ears, and are blind.
AnswerText: It's true! Koala joeys ARE born with no hair, no ears, and are blind!

QuestionText: Koalas hug trees to cool down.
AnswerText: Koalas actually DO hug trees to keep cool! It's true! Give it a try and see if it works!

QuestionText: Koalas have thicker fur on their rump, which provides a cushion when sitting on branches.
AnswerText: Koalas DO have thicker fur on their rump! Mother nature's travel cushion!

QuestionText: Koalas drink water every day, just like humans.
AnswerText: Actually Koalas don't often drink water! They get most of their water from eucalyptus leaves!

QuestionText: Koalas have opposable thumbs.
AnswerText: It's true! Koalas are like humans. They have two opposable thumbs so that they can firmly hold things.

QuestionText: Koalas get high from eucalyptus.
AnswerText: Koalas do not get high from eucalyptus. This is a common misconception.

QuestionText: Koalas have unique footprints like humans.
AnswerText: Koalas DO actually have unique fingerprints, just like humans!

QuestionText: When they are first born a koala joey is the size of a...
AnswerText: Koala joeys are born the size of a jellybean!

QuestionText: You can tell the sex of a koala by looking at their...
AnswerText: Look at a Koala's chest to identify the its sex. Male Koalas have a dark brown scent gland in the middle of their chest and female koalas have a plain white chest.

QuestionText: The peak koala breeding season in South East Queensland starts in...
AnswerText: The peak koala breeding season usually starts in South East Queensland in July.

QuestionText: How many grams of eucalyptus leaves do koalas eat on average a day?
AnswerText: Koalas on average eat up to 500g of eucalyptus leaves a day.

QuestionText: Koala joeys stay in their mother's pouch until they are around _______-months old.
AnswerText: Koala joeys stay in their mother's pouch until they are around 6-months old!

QuestionText: Scientists often refer to a male Koala as a:
AnswerText: Scientists often refer to a male Koala as a ‘buck’.

QuestionText: In Australia there are 900 different species of eucalyptus trees.  How many of these do koalas like to eat?
AnswerText: Koalas normally have around 10 species as their main preferred food source.

QuestionText: On average, adult koalas weigh between:
AnswerText: The average adult koala weighs 4-9 KG!

QuestionText: Scientists often refer to a female Koala as a...
AnswerText: Scientists often refer to a male Koala as a ‘doe’!

QuestionText: The peak koala breeding season in South East Queensland usually ends in...
AnswerText: The peak koala breeding season usually ends in South East Queensland in January.

QuestionText: On average how many hours a day does a koala sleep?
AnswerText: Koalas sleep between 18 to 22 hours each day.

QuestionText: On average koalas live for ____ years.
AnswerText: The average life span of a Koala is about 10 years.
